PhotoDescription: Photo of site walk document / folder with site ID (This should always be your first photo)
Compound from ground level (ALL sides & surrounding area)
At least (1) photo of overall tower (Photos facing each subject carrier sector preferred)
Zoom in on each antenna sector for subject carrier ONLY (Straight on & from each side of antenna mount, all sectors)
Site signage (Site number, FCC number - Warning signage is not needed)
Stand inside corners of compound - Take (3) pics: Looking down fence line (both directions) & middle of compound
All shared utility h-frames inside/outside compound ( All sides & close-ups of equipment attached)
Fiber Demarc/Meet-me-point (Illustrate on site sketch, obtain coordinates; Detailed & overall pictures) (If applicable)
Fiber demarc coordinates & brief description of type/location:
Transformer including information tag (nameplate) and rating (Pad, vault, or pole mounted)
Power lines/conduits running from transformer to site (If possible/applicable)
Meter w/ label & Photo of Disconnect Breaker or fuse rating (Should be next to meter w/ size indicated on breaker switch)
Overall platform/pad/shelter view (Should provide a general view of all equipment)
Profile view of all (4) sides of equipment platform/pad/shelter (Should be as clear and unobstructed as possible)
Carrier H-frame (Views from ALL sides and close-up views of equipment that is attached) (When present)
Carrier Telco: Telco board/Ciena/AAV & related junctions boxes (May vary by site. Can be inside shelter/on h-frame)
Ice Bridge/Cable Trays/Conduit Runs to tower from subject carrier equipment (Capture labels printed on cables)
Ice Bridge posts (Show where they’re located on pad/platform, if applicable) Put distance between posts on sketch
Radios/System Modules (Multiple views so mounts/grounding/cabling is visible)
Photograph space(s) within subject carrier lease area where equipment will fit (When SOW is adding equipment)

All cabinets on pads/platforms/shelters (Get overall photo, zoomed in photos of ALL internals including make/model, BBUs, rack mounted equipment, etc.)
 PLEASE GET INSIDES OF CABINETS & CAPTURE RECTIFIERS/CONVERTERS/BREAKERS/EMPTY SLOTS/BATTERIES…etc.
Any and all ground bars associated with subject carrier (At Radios, at tower, under ice bridge, on h-frame, in shelter, etc.)
Inside of DC Power Plant: Converters, rectifiers, batteries, empty slots, digital ready outs, power distribution units (PDU), other equipment.
Manufacturer sticker on multi-meter gang bank/trough. Usually indicates the incoming service on site; very important. (if not a stand alone meter)
Shelter sites: HVAC nameplate/sticker for subject carrier only. Other carrier's HVAC info not needed.
Meter Bank with labeling and carrier/tenant name (Close up of existing tenant meter- meter number visible)
Manual Disconnect(s): Overall view, and nameplate photo of voltage/amperage/make
Automatic Transfer Switch (ATS)/Manual Transfer Switch (MTS may be within integrated PPC)
Existing PPC (Breaker Panel) (Be sure to get inside: Clear photos of panel schedule/breaker sizes/empty slots/labeling)
PPC generator plug/stand-alone gen plug (If present)
Generator: Overall and zoomed in
Generator name plate and detailed photos (If applicable) (Be sure to get voltage/phase/kW rating)
Overall view of each carrier’s lease space (Provide multiple images to aid in perspective if possible)
Four photos of equipment pad – one from each side (Make sure all cabinets are visible, no need to zoom on them)
H-frame(s) (Overall photos for location reference) (If applicable)
AAV equipment: Cienas/AAV/telco cabs
Junction box(es)
Ice Bridge/cable tray/ladder (Overall photos showing their locations)
Ice Bridge posts (Showing where they’re located within compound, if applicable & especially if close to lease area)
Meter Bank with labeling and carrier/tenant name
Manual Disconnect(s)
Automatic Transfer Switch (ATS)/Manual Transfer Switch (MTS may be within integrated PPC)
PPC (Breaker Panel) exterior
Overall view of each carrier’s lease space (Provide multiple images to aid in perspective if possible)
Four photos of equipment pad – one from each side (Make sure all cabinets are visible, no need to zoom on them)
